description: Was driving me nuts always logging in as admin even though I setup other, normal user accounts on my server. The solution is to uninstall this client, then delete the ~/.config/Nextcloud, ~/.local/Nextcloud, and ~/.Nextcloud folders. Logout of your admin account in firefox, login with your Nextcloud user account, reboot (yes, absolutely needed!), re-install the nextcloud client and it should then connect to your normal user account. There needs to be an account disconnect/selection option in the menus. Good luck.

There really is no proper Nextcloud client for Fedora for some reason. The official AppImage, flatpak, and Fedora repo version are all broken. The UI is terrible and inconsistent. The tray icon works with the AppImage but the AppImage doesn't install to the system so it doesn't autostart and doesn't include an icon in the menu. I did not have this experience in Ubuntu or PopOS

I've been using Nextcloud (client) on Windows, Ubuntu, Fedora KDE, and Fedora Gnome since 2017. It has always worked flawlessly. My server is running on a Raspberry Pi, crashed and re-installed once. I don't understand all the negative reviews except they must have configure things wrong or they have a bad network connection to their server.
It just does not work on Wayland (currently using Fedora 36). No autostart, freezes constantly, etc.

Works just as expected. It syncs my Ecloud (Murena) account and drive and keeps itself updated automatically because it's a Flatpak. I'm using this on KDE Plasma 5.25.5 desktop so system tray icons and menus are working as well.

It's the best open-source and private cloud solution on Linux and any other platform. Love it !!
By default the system-tray popup is opened when you launch the application. This window cannot be moved or resized, and closes if it loses focus.
I love Nextcloud. I love the server, the integrations and all I can do with it. But this client simply does not work - it crashes instantly and as of now effectively hinders me from doing my work.
Title says everything.
summary: It does the job. No problem. I don't see why people put 1 star

description:
1) In Fedora it does not decrypts files E2EE-ed folders (though it downloads them).
2) In client version 2 there was an "Account" button to add several account so sync... now its gone. no button.
summary: No E2EE decryption and no account button

description:
It's been a while since I used the sync client, and my god it has become quite the trainwreck. I've tried the DNF version, the Flatpak Version (from here) and the official AppImage from Nextcloud.com. They all show the same behavior:

- The UI Window has a form-factor that reminds me of a smartphone
- The UI WIndow doesn't have a handle of sorts or anything in fact that would allow me to resize or move it across the desktop
- But that's not an issue really, since the UI will just instantly disappear once it loses focus, never to be seen again
- There used to be a task-bar Icon for the sync client that showed the current status and allowed me to open the UI. That's plain gone. Once the UI window disappears, there really isn't a way to get it back (except for restarting the application)
- None of the (very few) buttons have any tooltip, and their Icons aren't all self explanatory

But the worst thing, really, is the fact that this **sync** client doesn't show the progress of **syncing** at all.

It hurts me to leave a review like this, but for me it's just not usable at all...
I was missing a desktop app to fully replace my dropbox usage with nextcloud. Now it is done.

It has room for improvement. I don't think the app itself looks great, and you need top icons extension from Gnome extensions to get the icon near the clock. It does what is supposed to do, but needs an interface refresh, and needs improvement in other areas.
I have been using it for some time now and use it to sync all my photos and documents cross platform and between multiple Linux systems, Windows, Android and it all works a treat. Great product.
I can't find a version that is usable. There is clearly no desire to have a functional client for Linux, which is odd.
Linux users are forgotten, again.
Funny, that worked on Plasma as supposed, but on phosh won't fit on screen :(

Seems to work fine in Debian 11 testing. Client could be a little prettier but functionality seems to be there.

I also tried the "online accounts" connection to Nextcloud. This mounts your Nextcloud as a remote share in the files application which I guess might be preferable for some people.
I use the Nextcloud client on other platforms just fine. This package installed via Fedora software utility starts and then crashes. Please package this properly and test.
Tested on Arch Linux, no issues so far. Perfect!
summary: Works as intended on Arch Linux

description:
The latest nextcloud-client is broken. Everything after version 2.6.5 doesn't work properly in Gnome and Wayland.

My only workaround has been to use an older Appimage (Nextcloud-2.6.5-x86_64.AppImage), which works the way the App used to.

As others has mentioned Online accounts isn't an alternative as it just mounts a share. Not an option if you sync local folders.
it works on fedora 33 flatpak
The client itself sucks and work when it wants to. But it adds the Nextcloud/ folder as bookmark to Nautilus, which is fine enough for me
Been using for several months with no issue.
summary: Working great on Arch Linux installed via RebornOS

description: Doesn't work on Ubuntu 21.04, clearly an outdated version, no idea how outdated though.
You are better off with the APPIMAGE. The app only seems to launch once, after a log-off or reboot, the app wont even launch again.
It just works. It does exactly what it says it does.
I use this client on KDE Plasma and Dolphin has really nice integration with this Nextcloud Client.
The Client works as expected but it would be nice so see in the future are native Gnome Nextcloud Client
summary: For the Flatpak Version is working !

description: It is junk if it will not allow a self signed certificate.
Pro Tip: If you are havig issues with the Nextcloud-Sync Client, google for and download the old 2.6.5-Version (as an appimage). Thats the newest version that runs without issues on my system...
summary: Quiely stops syncing files in the background, UI freezes regularly

description: It's not functional at all. How can you approve it and deploy into production? Doesn't work with GNOME on any distribution. But, it's pretty neat in my Gentoo KDE. So avoid this fr if you're using GNOME.
summary: Does it even work? Why bother? Just Why?

description: Moved to Fedora from Windows 10, was looking for a good alternative to iCloud Drive (which really lets you down when you're outside the apple ecosystem). This works flawlessly for my use-case, which is an Obsidian note repository. No more endlessly duplicated files, no more inability to write into the document, no more endless syncing. It just works.
Works as described, thanks

Nextcloud Desktop will sync my files, but after a few minutes it locks up and hammers my CPU.
Once my files are synced for the day I have to go into System Monitor and kill the Nextcloud background process.

Appears to be written in Javascript or something. Held together with string and hope. A native application written in C/C++ with proper threading etc. would go a long way to improving this companies offerings on both the server and client side. Client locks up after running for a while.
The software obviously is not optimized for Gnome or Fedora or anything, autostart does not work for me. But it does it's job most of the time. So... it's okay, but definitely not good
summary: It runs, but not that well and not automatically

description: It does what it is supposed to do - synchronize files.

This client is unfortunately a bad joke. It constantly freezes and shows sync warnings every couple of minutes for files that are long solved. Only a restart fixes this warning-bs. Beware that if you plan to use it for your Keepass files you will get in sync warning hell.
summary: Constantly freezes and throws sync errors

description: Does not work well with Gnome. No Autostart.
Just deleted all my nextcloud files while trying to get it to work with current fedora/gnome setup. Reconfiguring the account made it sync an epty folder, deleting all of my files :(
summary: Love Nextcloud but don't hate desktop client

description: Works as expected

Eigentlich ist der Nextcloud Desktop-Client ein sehr gutes Programm, aber leider ist nur eine Qt-Version erhältlich. Es wäre schön, wenn auch eine GTK-Version erhältlich wäre, da Qt halt nicht komplett FOSS ist.
summary: Sehr gutes Programm, aber leider ohne GTK-Version

description: nichts zu beanstanden

Sync funktioniert nicht, die Bedienung ist eine Zumutung.
Traurig, dass Fedora im Software-Verzeichnis keinen vernünftig funktionierenden Nextcloud-Sync-Client anbietet und man stattdessen auf den Snap Store oder App-Images ausweichen muss.

Works nice, Only Problem is that you cant remove Users, because if you try, it crashes
fedora 36 KDE

Este es el cliente para tener sincronizado tu ordenador con el servidor.

En la descripción dice que no es libre pero sí lo es, el código está en GitHub y se puede colaborar.

Ce petite logiciel et trés bien conçus et permet vraiment de correctement mettre en place la sychonisation des fichier avec nextcloud. Je n'est jammais eu aucun bugs avec il ne faut juste pas chercher à sychroniser des node_modules parce que il peut y en avoirs pours des heures. Mais vu que on peut choisir quelle dossier sychnosier cela ne pose pas de problèmes
summary: Indispensable Pour La Sychonisation Avec NextCloud

description:
Un bel outil qui fonctionne plutot bien.
Mon Compte est lié avec la Valise Chapril qui s'occupe de la maintenance.
La partie Client fonctionne très très bien. 

C'est pour moi une véritable alternative à google Drive et MS OndeDrive et consoeurs
summary: Un cloud puissant que l'on peut mettre a disposition de ses proches

description: Does what I ask it to do: sync my files with my Nextcloud. And it's fast.
summary: What can I say, it just works

description:
Fonctionne correctement, la synchronisation est rapide.

Juste un légé bug d'interface, quand je clique sur l'icone pour afficher l'historique des fichiers synchroniser, elle apparait à l'autre bout de l'écran.

L'app de synchronisation fonctionne très bien.

L'intégration avec Gnome est un peu bizarre, mais c'est surtout un problème de Gnome. Pour plus de facilité à retrouver Nextcloud qui roule en arrière plan, vaut mieux installer l'extention de Gnome "AppIndicator and KStatusNotification" via l'app "Extension Manager".
